channel.title: Compile help
channel.description:
What type of java do i need when i should compile a client/server?
when i try compile it says i don't have java.
:| :eek:

item.title: Compile help
item.dc:creator: @iz3_legend iz3 legend
item.description:
@iz3_legend wrote:

thats just one compiler, compilers are almost all coded diffrently depending on the server
and jdk developent kit just google it. Also If its class path is wrong go into

compuer/c:/program files/java and u should see your update mine for example is: jdk1.6.0.23 and you would go and click “edit” the compiler and check what update it has. If its like jdk1.6.0.19 just change it to your update and you should be good

Read full topic

item.title: Compile help
item.dc:creator: @Unit666 Unit666
item.description:
@Unit666 wrote:

edit the compiler to the version of java you have or just replace it with this

@echo off @TITLE Server if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. :end echo Finished! pause exit
and if that doesn't work you must have installed something else other than jdk, or check the environment variables.

Read full topic
